alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Montgomery; Randolph; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:30PM EDT until September 30 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Davidson, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Randolph and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall is expected, which combined with the strong winds will result in an increased risk of uprooted trees. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durham, High Point, Sanford, Asheboro, Lexington, Albemarle, Southern Pines, Randleman, Pittsboro, Troy, Carthage, North Carolina Zoo, Siler City, Badin Lake, Thomasville, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Biscoe, Goldston and Seagrove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
